com.example.cs309_cynote

Class APICalls

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.cs309_cynote.APICalls

  • public class APICalls
extends java.lang.Object
    API used to send information to the server, contains several types of HTTP requests
    Since:
    2019-02-17

      • volleyPost

        protected void volleyPost(java.lang.String urlString,
                          java.lang.String data,
                          com.android.volley.Response.Listener<java.lang.String> responseListener,
                          com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
                   throws org.json.JSONException
        Volley-based post request, used to send post requests to any formatted urlString and receive data using Response listeners
        Parameters:
        urlString - String representing the url to send data to
        data - Data to be packaged with the post request to be sent to the supplied url
        responseListener - Response.Listener, used to handle success responses. Object must be initialized with desired methods before being passed as parameter. Example in Class 'Login', method 'loginToUID'
        errorListener - Response.ErrorListener, used to handle error responses. Object must be initialized with desired methods before being passed as parameter. Example in Class 'Login', method 'loginToUID'
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException

      • volleyGet

        public void volleyGet(java.lang.String urlString,
                      com.android.volley.Response.Listener<java.lang.String> responseListener,
                      com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Volley-based get request, used to send get requests to any formatted urlString and receive data using Response listeners
        Parameters:
        urlString - String representing the url to send request to, must include all parameters in the form "sampleUrl.com/endpoint" or "sampleUrl.com/endpoint?data1=12345&data2=something"
        responseListener - Response.Listener, used to handle success responses. Object must be initialized with desired methods before being passed as parameter. Example in Class 'Login', method 'loginToUID'
        errorListener - Response.ErrorListener, used to handle error responses. Object must be initialized with desired methods before being passed as parameter. Example in Class 'Login', method 'loginToUID'
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • volleyGetArray

        public void volleyGetArray(java.lang.String urlString,
                           com.android.volley.Response.Listener<java.lang.String> responseListener,
                           com.android.volley.Response.ErrorListener errorListener)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Volley-based get request, used to send get requests to any formatted urlString and receive data using Response listeners. This particular method returns an array.
        Parameters:
        urlString - String representing the url to send request to, must include all parameters in the form "sampleUrl.com/endpoint" or "sampleUrl.com/endpoint?data1=12345&data2=something"
        responseListener - Response.Listener, used to handle success responses. Object must be initialized with desired methods before being passed as parameter. Example in Class 'Login', method 'loginToUID'
        errorListener - Response.ErrorListener, used to handle error responses. Object must be initialized with desired methods before being passed as parameter. Example in Class 'Login', method 'loginToUID'
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getUID

        public void getUID(android.view.View view,
                   java.lang.String screenname,
                   java.lang.String password)
        Given correct login information, this method calls the server for a UserID. This method then calls getClassList with the received UserID to make another get request for the list of classes tied to the user. Screenname, password --> Server UserID <-- Server
        Parameters:
        view - View selected to submit login form
        screenname - Screenname/Username to submit
        password - Password to submit

      • getClassList

        public void getClassList(android.view.View view,
                         int UID)
        Upon successfully submitting login form and receiving a UserID, call this method (usually through a callback object) with received UID to get the list of classes tied to UID UID --> Server Class List <-- Server
        Parameters:
        view - View selected to submit login form
        UID - Received ID from login

      • getModuleList

        public void getModuleList(android.view.View view,
                          java.lang.String className,
                          int CID)
        Get request using class ID to get the list of modules associated with this class CID --> Server Module List <-- Server
        Parameters:
        view - View selected to submit login form
        CID - CID of class to search
